result.execSummary:
The defendant Christina Anne Hoyt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christina Anne Hoyt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christina Anne Hoyt was found guilty of Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Christina Anne Hoyt was found guilty of Intentionally Point Firearm At Person, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Ct#3

miscConds.notes: Bond Condition to continue: No possession of a firearm.

Pay all supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Comply with all recommends imposed by Agent.
Bond conditions to continue: No contact with John P Biederman, Tyler John Churchill, Jacob Kurt Ingli, Benjamin Reeser, Lonnie J Seipel and Jason C Yarwood.

supervisions.notes:
same as Ct#2
Concurrent with: Ct#2

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christina Anne Hoyt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from JA Feuerhelm to Ms Melanie Weberg's letter. "Judge Boles has reviewed your letter advised that he does not have jurisidiction of the case any longer as she is on probation. You may wish to address your concerns with her Probation Agent"

2:05 p.m.  Defendant Christina Anne Hoyt in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thorie - plead guilty to Ct 2 and 3, State would move to dismiss Ct. 1, S/W, 2 years probation, no possession of firearms and comply with any recommendations of agent.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant.    Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Count 2 and Count 3.    Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Count 2 and Count 3.  Court dismisses Count 1.  Court orders:  S/W, 2 years probation to run concurrent, bond conditions to continue, comply with all recommendations as set by agent, court costs on each count in the amount of $465.00.  Appeal rights are given.
Status conference on July 11, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 9, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Information is filed with the court. Court reviews the information with the defendant. further reading is waived.   DEF PLEADS NOT GUILTY to Ct 1,2,& 3. Court receives the pleas. Set for PTC. Bond conditions are reviewed with thte defendant by the Judge.

9:40 Defendant Christina Anne Hoyt in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Robby Jaeger swn, ex by Atty Thorie. Atty Loberg x ex. Exh#1-picture of google maps.  Exh 1 is offered and received for illustrative purpose.  Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirments.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Court goes over bond conditions with Def. Def to report Trac phone number to the clerk's office within 5 days.

3:48 Defendant Christina Anne Hoyt in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared in court.  Defendant has copy of complaint,  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. THorie: $3000 signature. No possession of a firearm and no contact with named individuals in Ct#1. Nelson has no objection to signature, but objection to no possession. Def addresses to possession of guns. Mr Hoyt agrees to store firearms at his mother's residence.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
